column4: Does anyone know how to kill a program if it's not listed in top?
this is the output: 20022  0.0  0.0   3324   800 pts/3    S+   22:51   0:00 grep Skype
oh, ok. i thought it wasn't working. in which case i would say that skype is not running
how can I kill this unkillable skype process?
you have to be more specific about what the problem is. skype isn't running
when I try to load skype and login, it says "Another skype instance may exist"
I still can't login to skype
it makes a backup of your skype directory and then deletes the original
the output I got was cp: omitting directory `.Skype'
you might need a -R in the cp, so cp -R .Skype .Skype-backup && rm -R .Skype
